Class Util

    • Method Detail

      • clamp

        public static float clamp(float val,
          float min,
          float max)
        Clamps a floating point value between a specific range.

        TODO: Perhaps make this a static method in a static Math3D class.

        Parameters:
        val - The value to be clamped
        min - The minimum value that val should be. If val is less than this, then this is returned.
        max - The maximum value that val should be. If val is greater than this, then this is returned.
        Returns:
        If val is within the range (min, max), then val. Otherwise, if val is below min, min is returned. Otherwise, if val is above max, max is returned.

      • vectorLength

        public static float vectorLength(float x,
                 float y)
        Calculates the 2D vector length from two floating point values.

        TODO: Perhaps make this a static method in a VectorMath class, or a member method in a Vector2f class.

        Parameters:
        x - The x value of the vector
        y - The y value of the vector
        Returns:
        The length of the vector defined by (x, y)

      • vectorReflect

        public static float vectorReflect(float vec,
                  float normal,
                  float dot)
        Calculates one component of a vector reflection.

        All parameters must be from the same components in the various vectors for the results to be meaningful. For instance, if vec is an x component of the initial vector, then normal should be the x component of the reflection normal. Otherwise, the result will be meaningless.

        If called correctly, the result will be the corresponding component in the reflection vector. For instance, if vec and normal are x components, then the result will be the x component of the reflection vector.

        TODO: Perhaps make this a static method in a VectorMath class, or a member method in a Vector2f class.

        Parameters:
        vec - The component of interest in the initial vector
        normal - The component of interest in the reflection normal
        dot - The dot product between the initial vector and the reflection normal.
        Returns:
        The component of interest in the final reflection vector

      • lerp

        public static float lerp(float a,
         float b,
         float amt)
        Performs a linear interpolation to calculate a value that is amt way between a and b.

        For instance, if amt is one half (1/2, or 0.5), then the result will be half way between a and b. If amt is 3/4 (or 0.75), then the result will be 3/4 of the way between a and b.

        TODO: Perhaps make this a static method in a static Math3D class.

        Parameters:
        a - The starting value
        b - The ending value
        amt - The amt between a and b to calculate.
        Returns:
        The value that is amt way between a and b.
